item.title: Pakistan air force chief in US to strengthen defence cooperation
item.description: Air Chief Marshal Zaheer Ahmed Baber Sidhu's US visit marks a significant step in bolstering Pakistan-US defence cooperation, following a similar tour by the army chief. Discussions with US military and political leaders focused on enhancing bilateral military ties, joint training, and technology exchange.

item.title: Michael Madsen, 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Kill Bill' star, dies at 66
item.description: Michael Madsen, renowned for his menacing roles in Quentin Tarantino's films like "Reservoir Dogs" and "Kill Bill," has passed away at 66. He was found unresponsive at his Malibu home on Thursday morning. While the cause is believed to be cardiac arrest, no foul play is suspected.

item.title: Trump's 'big, beautiful' bill wins congressional approval
item.description: The Republican-controlled House approved President Trump's tax-cut package, sending it to him for signing. The bill makes the 2017 tax cuts permanent, funds immigration enforcement, and introduces new tax breaks, while cutting health and food programs. It is projected to add $3.4 trillion to the national debt. Democrats opposed the bill, criticizing it as a giveaway to the wealthy.

item.title: '94 killed in Gaza overnight, including 45 waiting for aid'
item.description: Israeli airstrikes and shootings intensified in Gaza, resulting in the deaths of 94 Palestinians on Wednesday and Thursday. Among the casualties were 45 individuals seeking humanitarian aid, with a strike on a tent camp in southern Gaza claiming the lives of at least 13 members of a single family, including six children.

item.title: ‘Biggest bill ever signed’: Donald Trump’s first comments after ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ passes US Congress
item.description: House Republicans passed the 'ONE BIG BEAUTIFUL BILL,' securing President Trump's signature on July 4. The legislation makes permanent $4.5 trillion in tax cuts, introduces new tax breaks, and enacts $1.2 trillion in spending cuts targeting Medicaid and food stamps. It also allocates $350 billion for border security and raises the national debt ceiling by $5 trillion.

Over 200 gurdwaras in UK form alliance to provide collective voice to reset relations with govt
item.description: A Pakistani minister attended the UK Gurdwara Alliance launch in London, aimed at strengthening ties between gurdwaras and the UK government. This alliance, representing over 200 UK gurdwaras, seeks to unify the Sikh community's voice. It will engage with organizations like Akal Takht and SGPC, addressing issues impacting gurdwaras.

item.title: Blankets, storms, vote-a-Rama: Trump’s tax bill sparks marathon week on Capitol Hill; race to meet July 4 deadline
item.description: The US Capitol saw intense activity this week. Republican lawmakers faced pressure to pass President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill. A marathon Senate session addressed concerns. Senator Lisa Murkowski's support helped the bill move forward. House Speaker Mike Johnson called lawmakers back. Despite criticism, the House narrowly passed the bill.

item.title: Dubai: 10-year-old reports father’s abuse through Dubai Police smart app
item.description: A 10-year-old boy in Dubai used the Dubai Police smart app to report repeated abuse by his father. Although he didn't understand why he was singled out for punishment, the boy’s visible bruises and emotional distress prompted intervention. Authorities warned the father, offering emotional support to the child while ensuring ongoing monitoring and counseling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Won’t attack US: Iran says no plans to escalate, but will continue Uranium enrichment; open for talks
item.description: Iran says it will not retaliate further for US strikes on its nuclear program. A senior official says Iran is open to talks with Washington. However, Iran will continue developing its nuclear program. Deputy foreign minister Majid Takht-Ravanchi confirms this. He adds that Iran wants assurances that the US will not use military force during negotiations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Dubai residents with Dh15k-20k salary can now buy a Dh1 million house with 'first home' initiative
item.description: Dubai's First-Time Homeownership Initiative offers residents earning between Dh15,000-Dh20,000 a pathway to homeownership with benefits like up to 10% discounts, flexible mortgage terms, and better financing options. By exploring affordable properties under Dh1 million, individuals can strategically plan their purchase, easing into homeownership with manageable payments. This initiative supports mid-income earners in achieving their property goals.

item.title: 'Won't back down': Putin tells Trump Russia will pursue Ukraine goals, in 6th call since January
item.description: In a recent call, Vladimir Putin told Donald Trump that Russia seeks a negotiated resolution to the Ukraine conflict but remains firm on its objectives, citing "root causes." Despite Trump's push for a swift end to hostilities, Putin conveyed Russia's willingness to resume talks with Kyiv, even as Moscow intensifies its military actions.

item.title: He didn't shake hands: Angela Merkel calls Donald Trump attention-seeker; recalls incident from 2017
item.description: Angela Merkel criticised Donald Trump at an event in Athens. She recalled an incident where Trump refused to shake her hand. Merkel believed Trump sought attention and wanted to distract people. She urged the European Union to stand firm against Trump's tariffs. Merkel also highlighted differences in their worldviews. She described their strained relationship during his presidency.

item.title: What is the Nankai Trough megaquake and why it could be fatal for Japan, according to Ryo Tatsuki’s prediction
item.description: Japan has approved a comprehensive disaster preparedness strategy to mitigate the impact of a potential Nankai Trough megaquake. Government projections warn of up to 298,000 deaths and widespread destruction. The plan, updating 2014 guidelines, aims to reduce fatalities by 80% and damage by 50% in ten years. It includes retrofitting homes, upgrading tsunami shelters, and enhancing early warning systems.

item.title: Ukraine arms freeze sparks GOP fury: Pentagon’s pause catches Donald Trump allies off guard; target Colby
item.description: A recent US decision to halt some weapon shipments to Ukraine, driven by Pentagon concerns over depleted stockpiles, has sparked widespread surprise and frustration. The move, spearheaded by Pentagon policy chief Elbridge Colby, reportedly lacked coordination across the administration, alarming European allies and raising questions about America's commitment to Kyiv's defense.

item.title: Massachusetts cop shot: Fellow officer fired during armed confrontation; fiancé had warned of danger to infant
item.description: A Massachusetts police officer, Kelsey Fitzsimmons, was shot during an armed confrontation while officers attempted to serve her with an abuse prevention restraining order requested by her fiancé. The firefighter fiancé expressed fears for their infant son's safety and Fitzsimmons' well-being, citing troubling behavior and suicidal threats during and after her pregnancy.
